cz.ive.location
Class CommonArea

java.lang.Object
  cz.ive.messaging.SyncHook
      cz.ive.iveobject.IveIdImpl
          cz.ive.iveobject.IveObjectImpl
              cz.ive.location.WayPointImpl
                  cz.ive.location.CommonArea
All Implemented Interfaces:
IveId, IveObject, Area, WayPoint, Hook, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Area2DGrid, SimpleArea
public abstract class CommonArea
extends WayPointImpl
implements Area

Common predecessor of all areas implementing methods, which are WayPoint-net-implementation independent.

Author:
pavel
See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

objectPlaces

private java.util.HashMap<ObjectClass,java.util.List<WayPoint>> objectPlaces
Defines which objets should be placed on which WayPoints when expanding. Each object will be placed on the WayPoint with the most specific class id on the way from the object's id to the root.

expansionInfo

private CommonArea.ObjectExpansionInfo expansionInfo
Information needed to expand the location.

inherentObjectsGenerated

private boolean inherentObjectsGenerated
Determines whether inherent object were generated yet from expansionInfo. This is used during expansion to decide whether generate objects from inherent map or from expansionInfo.

phantomGenerationInfo

protected CommonArea.PhantomGenerationInfo phantomGenerationInfo
Information needed to generate phantoms during expand.

expandHook

protected GuiHook expandHook
GuiHook to be signaled when expanding

GuiHook to be signaled when shrinking

Creates a new instance of CommonArea

realPosition - coordinates of the new WayPoint
kind - Kind of the area
info - Expansion info
Throws:
ObjectRegistrationFailedException
Method Detail

defineObjectPlace

public void defineObjectPlace(ObjectClass objClass,
                              WayPoint place)
Description copied from interface: Area
Defines a WayPoint, on which will be placed objects of the given class id when expanding. On that place will be placed each object, whose class id is equal to the given id, or is a child and no more specific place was found. In case of more places for one object, a random one will be chosen.

Specified by:
defineObjectPlace in interface Area
Parameters:
objClass - Class of objects, which should be placed there
place - WayPoint to place the objects

undefineObjectPlace

public void undefineObjectPlace(ObjectClass objClass,
                                WayPoint place)
Description copied from interface: Area
Undefines object place for the given class id. Reverse action of defineObjectPlace().

Specified by:
undefineObjectPlace in interface Area
Parameters:
objClass - Class to remove the place from
place - Place to undefine

undefineObjectPlace

public void undefineObjectPlace(ObjectClass objClass)
Description copied from interface: Area
Undefines all object places for the given class id. Reverse action of defineObjectPlace().

Specified by:
undefineObjectPlace in interface Area
Parameters:
objClass - Class to undefine

Description copied from interface: Area
Clears all defined object places.

Specified by:
clearObjectPlaces in interface Area

getBorderWayPoints

public java.util.List<WayPoint> getBorderWayPoints(WayPoint neighbour)
Getter for WayPoints that are behind the border in the Area specified by a possibly empty WayPoint (with at least valid id).

Specified by:
getBorderWayPoints in interface Area
Parameters:
neighbour - WayPoint representing an adjacent Area
Returns:
array of possibly empty WayPoint that are situated in the Area represented by neighbour parameter and that are accessible in a single step.

findNewWayPoint

public WayPoint findNewWayPoint(WayPoint old)
Finds in it's direct childs WayPoint which has the same id as the given one, or it's id is a parent id of the given one. This is needed to find the position for an object, which remembers it's position in the subtree, but the childs were newly generated.

Parameters:
old - The remembered position
Returns:
The child WayPoint, null if it was not found

findObjectPlaceSpecial

protected IveObject findObjectPlaceSpecial(IveObject object)
This method can define special placement for some objects.

Parameters:
object - Object to find place for
Returns:
null if the standard placement should be used, WayPoint if the standard placement should be overridden (the object will be placed on this WayPoint), or IveObject if the object should be placed to slaves of the return object.

findObjectPlace

public WayPoint findObjectPlace(IveObject object)
Description copied from interface: Area
Finds object place for the given object among childs. Considers object's class, kind and substantiality.

Specified by:
findObjectPlace in interface Area
Parameters:
object - Object to find place for
Returns:
WayPoint Place for the object, null if no WayPoint found

expandPlaceObject

protected void expandPlaceObject(IveObject object)
                          throws NoObjectPlaceException
Takes an object and places it to some sublocation according to it's class id. This is only the helper function for expandPlaceObjects().

Parameters:
object - Object to be placed
Throws:
NoObjectPlaceException

Generates a registerable id for a new object.

Parameters:
base - Base of the id (e.g. "chair")
Returns:
Id, which can be registered in ObjectMap, and number of the object

expand

public void expand()
            throws NoObjectPlaceException
Description copied from interface: WayPoint
Called when LOD of this WayPoint is being increased. An object may want to create some subobjects. Throws NoObjectPlaceException if cannot find a WayPoint to place some object.

Specified by:
expand in interface Area
Specified by:
expand in interface WayPoint
Overrides:
expand in class WayPointImpl
Throws:
NoObjectPlaceException

public void shrink()
Description copied from interface: WayPoint

Specified by:

Specified by:

registerGuiExpandListener

public void registerGuiExpandListener(Listener listener)
Registers new expand listener. This should be used only by u Gui, since the callback is performed in the Swing thread with the Simulation lock locked.

Specified by:
registerGuiExpandListener in interface Area
Parameters:
listener - callback to be called when expanding.
